data.title: Alpha Omega Alpha
data.meta_description: Fifty-nine members of Alpha Omega Alpha are Nobel laureates: Chemistry 2012, Robert J. Lefkowitz (Student Member, 1965)For studies of G-protein-coupled receptors 2003, Peter Agre (Alumnus Member, 1997)For the discovery of water channels 2003, Roderick MacKinnon (Student Member, 1982)For structural and mechanistic studies of ion channels 1989, Thomas Cech (Honorary Member, 2011)For the discovery of catalytic properties […]
data.text:
2012, Robert J. Lefkowitz (Student Member, 1965)

For studies of G-protein-coupled receptors

2003, Peter Agre (Alumnus Member, 1997)

For the discovery of water channels

2003, Roderick MacKinnon (Student Member, 1982)

For structural and mechanistic studies of ion channels

1989, Thomas Cech (Honorary Member, 2011)

For the discovery of catalytic properties of RNA

1980, Paul Berg (Honorary Member, 1992)

For his fundamental studies of the biochemistry of nucleic acids, with particular regard to recombinant-DNA

1946, Wendell M. Stanley (Honorary Member, 1938)

For the preparation of enzymes and virus proteins in a pure form.
